title: Soyuz MS-21 scheduled to land on the Kazakh steppe on Thursday
summary: The Soyuz MS-21 spacecraft, which launched three Russian cosmonauts to the International Space Station on March 18 of this year, is scheduled to touch down in the Kazakh steppe. MS-21 will land outside of Dzhezkazgan on Thursday, Sept. 29, completing a 195-day mission in low Earth orbit.

title: Shift to remote work draws mixed reactions
summary: Some space company leaders are embracing the trend toward remote work. Others caution against it. In any case, the pandemic has changed the calculus for current and prospective employees.

title: Lamborn: ‘Merit on both sides’ of debate over Space National Guard
summary: Rep. Doug Lamborn (R-Colo.), a key congressional proponent of establishing a Space National Guard, said he would consider an alternative proposal endorsed by Space Force leaders and by the Biden administration.

title: SpaceX, ULA postpone launches as Hurricane Ian moves toward Florida
summary: The forecast track of Hurricane Ian across Central Florida has forced SpaceX and United Launch Alliance to postpone several launches planned in the coming days at Cape Canaveral, including the next crew flight to the International Space Station, a Starlink mission, and the liftoff of an Atlas 5 rocket.

title: NASA Awards Commercial Small Satellite Data Acquisition Agreement
summary: NASA has selected GHGSat, Inc., of Montreal, Quebec, Canada, to provide commercial small constellation satellite products for evaluation to determine the utility for advancing NASA’s science and application goals. GHGSat will provide a comprehensive catalogue of Earth Observation data High Resolution Gas Detection Commercial Earth Observation Data
